title: TFR Ep. 590: Scream, The Worst Person In The World, 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films
description:
This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the potential revitalization of one of the most popular horror franchises of the 90’s and aughts.  It’s Scream!  What’s with the re-using of original titles lately? TCM, Halloween, now Scream?  Weird.  So How have Sidney, Gale, and Dewey been?  What’s up in murder town, or as we also know it, Greensboro.  And who are all these young kids?  Then it’s on to the Norwegian import, ‘The Worst Person In The World’.  Getting lots of buzz, including a Best Actress win at Cannes, it’s another slice of life, coming of age film we’ve been specializing in lately.  But does it offer something different?  There’s the life-altering review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show closes with Matt and Chris sharing their 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films. Hola, Sidney!

00:00-18:40: Intro/Scream (2022)

18:41-27:44: Physical Media Picks

27:45-37:45: The Worst Person In The World

37:46-54:24: 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films

54:25-55:53: Wrap Up

Theme music by Jamal Malachi Ford-Bey

This week on The First Run, Chris and Matt discuss the potential revitalization of one of the most popular horror franchises of the 90’s and aughts.  It’s Scream!  What’s with the re-using of original titles lately? TCM, Halloween, now Scream?  Weird.  So How have Sidney, Gale, and Dewey been?  What’s up in murder town, or as we also know it, Greensboro.  And who are all these young kids?  Then it’s on to the Norwegian import, ‘The Worst Person In The World’.  Getting lots of buzz, including a Best Actress win at Cannes, it’s another slice of life, coming of age film we’ve been specializing in lately.  But does it offer something different?  There’s the life-altering review of the big releases on Physical Media, featuring the Streaming and Straight to DVD Picks of the Week.  The show closes with Matt and Chris sharing their 5 Favorite 90’s Horror Films. Hola, Sidney!
